metadata.title: CVE-2023-32258 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ksmbd, a high-performance in-kernelSMB server. The specific flaw exists within the processing of SMB2_LOGOFFand SMB2_CLOSE commands. The issue results from the lack of proper lockingwhen performing operations on an object. An attacker can leverage thisvulnerability to execute code in the context of the kernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32258` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
